fields.title: Desenvolvedor Frontend Vuejs
Business Tech Analyst II (Franqueados)
Desenvolvedor(a) full stack
fields.requirements:
O Núcleo Ressacada de Pesquisas em Meio Ambiente (REMA) da Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina (UFSC) está com processo seletivo aberto para contratação (CLT) de desenvolvedor(a) full stack (40h) para atuar em projeto com a Petrobras. O início previsto das atividades será a partir de outubro/2022.

Mais sobre a infraestrutura do REMA: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vN-s3qxD_Gs

Projeto alvo: Suíte integrada de simuladores matemáticos para definição de ações no gerenciamento de áreas contaminadas visando o encerramento de passivos da indústria do petróleo, gás e biocombustíveis - Projeto PETROBRAS.

Contratante: FEESC - Fundação de Ensino e Engenharia de Santa Catarina. Fundação de apoio à UFSC para execução de projetos de P&D&I.

Etapas do processo seletivo:

Etapa 0: Cadastro em https://forms.gle/wL96tcq7GeJWF5Kn9
Etapa 1: Análise curricular;
Etapa 2: Teste avaliativo 1 de programação;
Etapa 3: Entrevista;
Etapa 4: Teste avaliativo 2 de programação (para desempate, se necessário).
Formação solicitada: Ciências da Computação, ou Sistemas de Informação ou Engenharias (Eletrônica, Mecânica, Elétrica, Controle e Automação e afins).

fields.title: Software Engineer
fields.requirements:
This role is open to candidates living in Brazil to work remotely or from our location in Sao Paulo.


Example of Recent Projects:

Implemented a fully automated test and deployment pipeline
Migrated legacy code base to use .Net core and run on Docker Linux
Built a metrics service for on-demand business metrics service for Buyers
Ongoing integration across multiple parts of the organization as we work to align the US and EU-based components of our business

What You Will Do

Develop RESTful APIs to support both internal and external clients
Build reliable, maintainable, well documented features
Demonstrate a curiosity about developing software, learning new technologies and working with more experienced engineers to expand your knowledge and skills.
Execute full software development life cycle as part of an Agile team, including collaborating with the team to refine and modify requirements, estimate level of effort for work, follow established design paradigms and design patterns, and implement thorough unit and integration tests.
Drive delivery at a story/feature/bug level
Participate in an on-call rotation to monitor and support shipped features for success and issues
Support the business teams and product managers in data extracts and data analysis

What We Are Looking For

Exposure through course work or internships to software development
Bachelors or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent or coding boot camp with relevant project work
Ability to demonstrate hands-on software development experience in Python, Go/Golang, C#, or Java
Outstanding problem-solving and analytical skills
Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles
Strong written and verbal communication skills
You enjoy pushing the limits of your knowledge and experience every day.
Enjoys working as part of a team

Bonus Points If You Have

Experience with AWS or other cloud platform
Experience with NoSQL and cloud based distributed systems design
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
Proven experience with high volume and high-performance applications

fields.title: Software Engineer, Early Career
fields.requirements:
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working with Data Structures or Algorithms (e.g., data structures/algorithms class, coursework/projects, research, internships, or other experience in/outside of school or work (including open source hobby coding).
Ability to speak and write in English and Portuguese fluently.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience working in one or more of the following: web or mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development
Availability to start during this year.
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
Examples of coding in one of the following programming languages including but not limited to: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, or Python.

About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas, and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.

Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software.
Manage sole project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
Research, conceive, and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offering.
Collaborate on scalability issues involving access to data and information.

fields.title: Software Engineer, Early Career
fields.requirements:
Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language.

Note: Google’s hybrid workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:

In-office locations: São Paulo, State of São Paulo, Brazil; Belo Horizonte, State of Minas Gerais, Brazil.

Remote location(s): Brazil.

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working with Data Structures or Algorithms (e.g., data structures/algorithms class, coursework/projects, research, internships, or other experience in/outside of school or work (including open source hobby coding).
Ability to speak and write in English and Portuguese fluently.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience working in one or more of the following: web or mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development
Availability to start during this year.
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
Examples of coding in one of the following programming languages including but not limited to: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, or Python.

About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas, and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.

Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software.
Manage sole project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
Research, conceive, and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offering.
Collaborate on scalability issues involving access to data and information.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

fields.title: Analista de Dados (Belo Horizonte)
Business Analytics II
Especialista em Ciência de Dados I
Analista de Incidentes III - Vaga Afirm Mulheres

Frontend Developer - Research
fields.requirements:
Can be 100% remote for the right candidate

Office Location: Curitiba, Brazil

Job type: CLT

Our mission is to unlock human potential. We welcome you for who you are, and the background you bring, and we embrace individuals who get excited about learning. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion; it’s in our differences that we empower the way the world learns.

As a member of the Software Development tribe, with teams in France, Brazil, and the US, you will be integrated into a multi-disciplinary development squad working in Agile – Scrum mode.

How You Will Make An Impact
Build new features on existing products and brand-new experiences for our learners
Practice high-quality development methods: unit tests writing, code review, code standards
Actively participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies (daily meetings, refinement meetings, retrospectives)
Contribute to continuous improvement of our development processes

Who We Are Looking For
Work in a JavaScript framework (such as VueJS, React, Angular)
Able to apply best practices and standards to your daily work
Enthusiastic in implementing scalable solutions using the right tools. Our code base is mostly composed of PHP, Python, .NET, VueJS, but we care more about general development skills rather than skills on a language or framework
Enjoy solving complex problems using simple solutions
Work experience with Scrum Agile development framework and comfortable working with a close multiple competencies team
You are comfortable in reading, writing, and speaking in English, face to face or for an audience
Having work experience with some of these topics Amazon AWS, MySQL, GitLab / GitHub, Jenkins, Linux, Docker, Jira will be a key advantage.
Being familiar with DevOps practices will also help your day-to-day work.
